result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia

02:05 PM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 22CF428 and 22CF486
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into cases 22CF428 and 22CF486

Any monies posted in this matter to be applied to cases 22CF428 and 22CF486 and remaining funds to be refunded to poster.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:08 AM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Attorney Tapia is requesting a short adjournment as he was just given a pretrial offer. 
Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:53 AM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Tapia requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Defendant re: bail reduction hearing

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 06-05-2022 regarding request for a bail hearing.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 06-09-2022: No action, defendant has counsel.**
Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:37 AM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Alyssa Marilee Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducts a colloquy with defendant.
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files amended complaint and information. 
Atty Tapia accepts filing of the amended complaint and information and waives reading, enters not guilty pleas. 
Court sets new date.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Protective Order
Hearing on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James H Bozich
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 1560 S 71st Street, West Allis, WI 53214

Signed Protective Order
The original document name was titled: Signed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 05-10-2022

Proposed Protective Order
The original document name was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 05-10-2022

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use the internet.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

02:07 PM Defendant James H Bozich appeared by Zoom, in custody at Waukesha County Jail, with attorney Angela Wang.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Tapia will be appointed.
The Court orders the complaint sealed as the Victims name is sprinkled through out, in non complaince with Marsy's Law.
The Court orders the State to file an amended complaint.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 05-10-2022
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
